adjective.description: That tends or is able to spread out or expand; growing outwards.
Informal (chiefly North American). Easily spread in a thin or even layer; spreadable.
British informal. Of a meal: large and impressive on the table, lavish. Compare "spread". Now rare.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in John Partridge (fl. 1566–1582), translator and poet. Partly from spread + -y.
